Bio short version üá¨üáß

Nerea Luis is PhD in Artificial Intelligence from the Carlos III University of Madrid and is currently working as Artificial Intelligence Engineer at Sngular. She is an active and award-winning engineer, researcher and speaker in science and tech events. In 2016, she won the Google Anita Borg scholarship by Google for her technological initiatives. Among them is T3chFest, a free-of-entrance technology event (+2000 attendees) which also promotes and highlights the lack of diversity in that sector. In 2018 the COTEC Foundation selected her as an expert in Technology, Talent and Gender within its network ‚ÄúLos 100 de Cotec‚Äù. That same year she was selected as a scientific advising technician, in the Science in Parliament initiative promoted by Congress. Also in 2018, it has won the Innovative ICT recognition by the Cibervoluntarios Foundation and the Business Insider has recognized her as one of the 23 talents under 35 for leading the technological revolution. Recently, she has been awarded by the Royal House with the award for the Civil Merit Order and has been included on the Top 100 Women Leaders in Spain.
